remarks: Bézout's identity:  For any integers ` A ` and ` B ` , there are integers ` x , y ` such that ` ( A gcd B ) = A x. x + B x. y ` .  This is Metamath 100 proof #60.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Feb-2014.)
statement:
bezout $p |- ( ( A e. ZZ /\ B e. ZZ ) -> E. x e. ZZ E. y e. ZZ ( A gcd B ) = ( ( A x. x ) + ( B x. y ) ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x y $.
